subject: Re: [junit] JUnit documentation - I want to help!
msgSnippet: Tereza, Thanks for your mail!  The tutorial you linked to is definitely on the shorter side.  However, searching for JUnit tutorials does provide a number of
messageBody:
Tereza,

Thanks for your mail!  The tutorial you linked to is definitely on the shorter side.  However, searching for "JUnit tutorials" does provide a number of write-ups of varying lengths and quality.  Before you devote a lot of time to writing your own, I wonder if you think that perhaps one of those would be a good thing to link to as a supplement to what's on the github site?

Thanks,

   David 

On Fri, Oct 16, 2015 at 2:26 AM, jana novakova qwiriella@... [junit] <junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
 

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to you regarding JUnit tests tutorials. I am currently studying informatics at University of West Bohemia in Pilsen, and while browsing https://github.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Getting-started I discovered that very basic instructions on how to start using JUnit tests are quite brief. My supervisor has some tutorials for beginners; however, they are in Czech - not very useful for the rest of the world. I was thinking of perharps filling in this gap - I probably would be able to prepare a consistent introduction based on materials provided. 
Could it be useful for you? If so, I would appreciate some starting tips (suitable/recommended tools for writing, formating standards etc.)


Regards
Tereza S.
